page.title: 01North-West of Kirkcaldy
page.content: The greatest part of the North and West of this block is arable farming land of a smooth rolling nature rising to a height of 110m above sea level.In the NW corner is the tiny village of {Cluny.}The southern section is covered by the {Kirkcaldy}council housing built principally since the war, a sixteen unit industrial estate at{ {Hayfield} and the sprawling Wimpey private housing estate at{Dunnikier}. The main features of the town area are the mostly modern {Victoria Hospital}, five primary schools built at regular intervals after the war until 1971 and the split-site Junior and Senior buildings of {Kirkcaldy High School.} On the north edge of the town is the modern Crematorium and to the east is a large part of the {Dunnikier Golf {Club. }
